who are you: I am Jarvis, your AI-powered desktop assistant.
who is your creator: I was created by Arnab Dey.
introduce yourself: I am Jarvis, an AI assistant designed to help with software development, system control, and information retrieval. How may I assist you today?
what is your purpose: My purpose is to enhance your productivity by assisting with coding, system management, and providing accurate information.
how are you: I am functioning optimally, ready to assist you.
what can you do for me: I can control your system, answer technical questions, help with coding, manage your schedule, and retrieve information.

what is tabu search: Tabu search is a metaheuristic search method that uses local search methods.
what is gradient descent: Gradient descent is a first-order iterative optimization algorithm for finding a local minimum of a differentiable function.
what is stochastic gradient descent: Stochastic gradient descent is an iterative method for optimizing an objective function with suitable smoothness properties.
what is mini batch gradient descent: Mini-batch gradient descent is a variant of gradient descent that splits the training dataset into small batches.
what is momentum: Momentum is a method that helps accelerate gradient descent in the relevant direction.
what is nesterov momentum: Nesterov momentum is a variant of momentum that has better theoretical convergence guarantees.
what is adagrad: Adagrad is an algorithm for gradient-based optimization that adapts the learning rate to the parameters.
what is adadelta: Adadelta is an extension of Adagrad that seeks to reduce its aggressive, monotonically decreasing learning rate.
what is rmsprop: RMSprop is an unpublished adaptive learning rate method proposed by Geoff Hinton.
what is adam: Adam is an optimization algorithm that can be used instead of the classical stochastic gradient descent procedure.
what is adamax: Adamax is a variant of Adam based on the infinity norm.
what is nadam: Nadam is an extension of Adam that incorporates Nesterov momentum.
what is amsgrad: AMSGrad is a variant of Adam that is designed to converge to a better solution.
what is learning rate schedule: A learning rate schedule is a method for adjusting the learning rate during training.
what is learning rate decay: Learning rate decay is a method for reducing the learning rate over time.
what is cyclical learning rates: Cyclical learning rates is a method for setting the learning rate that cycles between a base and a maximum value.
what is one cycle policy: The one cycle policy is a learning rate schedule that uses one cycle of learning rate values.
what is warm restarts: Warm restarts is a method for resetting the learning rate to its initial value after a number of iterations.
what is early stopping: Early stopping is a form of regularization used to avoid overfitting when training a learner with an iterative method.
what is dropout: Dropout is a regularization technique for reducing overfitting in neural networks.
what is weight decay: Weight decay is a regularization technique that adds a penalty to the loss function.
what is batch normalization: Batch normalization is a technique for training very deep neural networks.
what is layer normalization: Layer normalization is a technique for normalizing the activations of a layer.
what is instance normalization: Instance normalization is a technique for normalizing the activations of a layer.
what is group normalization: Group normalization is a technique for normalizing the activations of a layer.
what is spectral normalization: Spectral normalization is a technique for stabilizing the training of discriminators in Generative Adversarial Networks.
what is weight initialization: Weight initialization is the process of setting the initial values of the weights of a neural network.
what is xavier initialization: Xavier initialization is a method for initializing the weights of a neural network.
what is he initialization: He initialization is a method for initializing the weights of a neural network.
what is orthogonal initialization: Orthogonal initialization is a method for initializing the weights of a neural network.
what is fine tuning: Fine-tuning is a process of taking a pre-trained model and training it further on a new task.
what is feature extraction: Feature extraction is the process of using a pre-trained model as a fixed feature extractor.
what is pre trained model: A pre-trained model is a model that has been trained on a large dataset and can be used for transfer learning.
what is model zoo: A model zoo is a collection of pre-trained models.
what is tensorflow hub: TensorFlow Hub is a library for the publication, discovery, and consumption of reusable parts of machine learning models.
what is pytorch hub: PyTorch Hub is a pre-trained model repository designed to facilitate research reproducibility.
what is huggingface transformers: HuggingFace Transformers is a library of pre-trained models for natural language processing.

list files in directory: Running command: ls -la  # or dir on Windows
make a new file: Running command: touch {filename}  # or type nul > {filename} on Windows
copy a file: Running command: cp {source} {destination}  # or copy on Windows
move a file: Running command: mv {source} {destination}  # or move on Windows
show disk usage: Running command: df -h  # or wmic logic on Windows
show top processes: Running command: top  # or tasklist on Windows
kill process [process_name]: Terminating process: {process_name}. Running command: pkill {process_name}  # or taskkill on Windows
search for a process: Searching for process. Running command: ps aux | grep {process_name}  # or tasklist | findstr on Windows
initialize a git repository: Initializing a new Git repository here. Running command: git init.
git status: Showing the status of the Git repository. Running command: git status.
git add all: Staging all changes. Running command: git add .
git commit: Committing changes. Please provide a commit message.
git push: Pushing commits to the remote repository. Running command: git push.
git pull: Pulling latest changes from the remote repository. Running command: git pull.
create a new branch: Creating a new branch. What should we name it?
run tests: Running the test suite for this project.
run linter: Running the linter on the codebase.
install dependencies: Installing project dependencies. Running command: npm install  # or pip install -r requirements.txt, etc.
what is the weather: Checking the weather for your location.
gcloud list instances: Running command: gcloud compute instances list
docker ps: Showing running containers. Running command: docker ps
docker logs [container]: Fetching logs for container: {container}. Running command: docker logs {container}
terraform init: Initializing Terraform. Running command: terraform init
terraform apply: Applying Terraform plan. Running command: terraform apply
clear terminal: Clearing the terminal screen. Running command: clear  # or cls on Windows
git log: Showing the commit history. Running command: git log --oneline
git checkout [branch]: Switching to branch: {branch}. Running command: git checkout {branch}
git merge [branch]: Merging branch: {branch} into the current branch. Running command: git merge {branch}
git stash: Stashing your uncommitted changes. Running command: git stash
git diff: Showing changes between commits, commit and working tree, etc.
check port [port_number]: Checking if port {port_number} is in use.
check internet speed: Testing your internet download and upload speed.
system information: Displaying detailed system information (OS, CPU, Memory).
enable service [service_name]: Enabling the service: {service_name} to start on boot.
disable service [service_name]: Disabling the service: {service_name} from starting on boot.
open postgres: Opening a connection to the local PostgreSQL database.
open mysql: Opening a connection to the local MySQL database.
run migrations: Running database migrations for the current project.
rollback migrations: Rolling back the last database migration.
seed database: Seeding the database with sample data.
open api documentation: Opening the API documentation (e.g., Swagger, Redoc) for the current project.
run formatter: Running the code formatter (e.g., Prettier, Black) on the codebase.
run type checker: Running the static type checker (e.g., mypy, TypeScript compiler).
show todos in code: Searching for TODO, FIXME, etc. comments in the codebase.
show recent files: Showing the most recently edited files in the project.
what is my current task: Checking the current task from your project management tool (e.g., Jira, Asana).
log work [time] [task]: Logging {time} to task {task} in your work management tool.
what are my meetings today: Checking your calendar for meetings scheduled today.
join my next meeting: Connecting you to your next scheduled meeting (Zoom, Teams, etc.).
take a break: Suggesting a 5-minute break. Setting a timer.
suggest a shortcut: Suggesting a keyboard shortcut for the last action you performed.
generate ssh key: Generating a new SSH key pair.
compress folder [folder_name]: Compressing the folder: {folder_name} into a zip archive.
what is my network speed: Running a quick network speed test.
monitor network traffic: Starting a tool to monitor real-time network traffic.
find large files: Finding files larger than 100MB in the current directory.
clean temp files: Cleaning temporary files to free up disk space.
update system: Checking for and installing system updates.
list installed packages: Listing all packages installed via package manager (e.g., brew, apt, pip).
brew update: Updating Homebrew and the list of available packages.
upgrade packages: Upgrading installed packages to their latest versions.
show hardware info: Displaying detailed hardware information (e.g., with lshw on Linux).
disconnect vpn: Disconnecting from the currently active VPN.
open aws console: Opening the AWS Management Console in your browser.
open azure portal: Opening the Microsoft Azure Portal in your browser.
open gcp console: Opening the Google Cloud Console in your browser.
show aws credentials: Showing the currently configured AWS credentials and region.
open kubernetes dashboard: Opening the Kubernetes dashboard for the current context.
forward port [port]: Forwarding local port {port} to a pod in the cluster.
describe pod [pod_name]: Showing detailed information about the pod: {pod_name}.
ssh into instance [instance_id]: Opening an SSH connection to EC2 instance: {instance_id}.
open s3 bucket [bucket_name]: Opening the S3 bucket: {bucket_name} in the browser.
create an issue: Creating a new issue on GitHub/GitLab for the current project.
what is the stock price of [ticker]: Checking the current stock price for {ticker}.
how is my portfolio doing: Checking the performance of your stock portfolio.
read this out loud: Reading the last response or selected text aloud.
speak slower: Reducing the speech rate of the assistant.
speak faster: Increasing the speech rate of the assistant.
change your voice: Changing the TTS voice to a different variant.
good morning: Good morning! Here's the weather and your calendar for the day.
good night: Good night! Shutting down non-essential processes. Sleep well.
flower: Flowers, also known as blossoms and blooms, are the reproductive structures of flowering plants.
electron: The electron (e-, or β− in nuclear reactions) is a subatomic particle whose electric charge is negative one elementary charge.
